text: The bilabial ejective is a type of consonantal sound, used in some spoken languages. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is . ==Features== Features of the bilabial ejective: ==Occurrence== In addition to the languages listed below, this sound is also a common phonological feature of the Ethiopian Linguistic Area, especially Ethiopian Semitic languages. {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2| Language ! Word ! IPA ! Meaning ! Notes |- |colspan=2| Adyghe | пӏакӏэ/pḣakḣė |align=center| | 'thin' | |- |colspan=2| Amharic | ጴጥሮስ/p̣iéṭraus |align=center| | 'Peter' | |- | Armenian | Yerevan dialect | պոչ/bochʿ |align=center| | 'tail' | Corresponds to tenuis in other Eastern dialects |- |colspan=2| Chechen | /phelg |align=center| | 'finger' | |- | colspan="2" | Ganza |colspan=2 align=center| | ‘gathering’ | |- | colspan=2 | Georgian | პაემანი/p'aemani |align=center| | 'meeting, date' | |- |colspan=2| Hadza | hûbbu |align=center| | 'to lift something heavy' | (mimetic) |- |colspan=2| Haida | ttappad |align=center| | 'to break' | (mimetic) |- |colspan=2| Kabardian | цӏапӏэ/claplè |align=center| | 'mean' | |- |colspan=2| Nez Perce | p’íłin |align=center| | 'hole' | |- ||Ossetian |Iron |пъовыр/phovyr |align=center| |'cook' | |- |colspan=2| Quechua | |align=center| | 'clothes' | |- |colspan=2| Ubykh | align="center" | саакӀъауәпӀцӀај/saaky'awəp'ţ'ay | | 'what is your name?' | See Ubykh phonology |} ==See also== *Index of phonetics articles ==Notes== ==References== * ==External links== * Category:Bilabial consonants Category:Ejectives Category:Oral consonants
